author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Soak up Miami’s history with a BOGO offer | www.palmbeachpost.com
text:
South Florida’s history was shaped by the immigration of people from different cultures who carried their dreams with them. They remade the region over and over again to give life to those dreams.
For a good look at their triumphs and travails, visit the HistoryMiami Museum in the Miami-Dade Cultural Center. A permanent exhibition there called “Tropical Dreams: A People’s History of South Florida” tells their stories.
A trolley from the 1920s is on display at HistoryMiami. Contributed Throughout October, HistoryMiami and other museums, parks, historic homes and zoos are offering discounted admission — or buy one, get one free admission — for Miami Attractions Month. For more information, visit www.miamiattractionsmonth.com .
HistoryMiami is at 101 West Flagler St., Miami. Admission is $10 for adults, $8 for seniors and students, $5 for children 6-12, and free for kids under 6.
For more information, call 305-375-1492 or visit www.historymiami.org/museum .
